unit_learning_outcomes.description: Apply valuation techniques to price alternative investments.
Construct and evaluate a portfolio with alternative investments.
Examine the common features of alternative investments and their markets and distinguish among the principal classes of alternative investments.
Assess the benefits, such as return enhancement and/or risk diversification.

enrolment_rules.description: AFIN6012 or ACST603 or ACST6003 or Admission to MFin

assessments.description: A closed book two hour examination will be held during University Examination Period.
Student will conduct quantitative and qualitative analysis and write a report of 1,500 - 2,500 words.
A closed book 90 minutes mid session test will be held in class.
An online mid session test of 90 minutes will be held to give students practice on a summative task and to provide feedback on their progress midway through the session.
An online open book two hour examination will be held during University Examination Period.

data.unit_offering_text:
Session 1, Weekday attendance, North Ryde
Session 1, Special circumstances
data.description: In the era of significant market turmoil, institutional, as well as individual investors look beyond traditional investment vehicles such as bonds and shares. Alternative investments are the fastest growing, and probably the least understood, sector of the investment industry. The purpose of this unit is to explore the world of alternative investments such as investments in hedge funds, private equity / venture capital funds, real estate, and commodities, either directly or through funds of funds. The unit gives students a solid understanding of the industry knowledge and techniques that should be part of the toolkit of any money manager who advises private and institutional clients on the inclusion of alternative investments in their portfolio.
data.title: Alternative Securities
